snapshots.summary: Initial baseline analysis of ServiceNow connectors

keyGaps.gap: Microsoft lacks AI agents, ticket summarization, response drafting, and knowledge article generation - all available in Glean
Microsoft incremental crawls don't update permissions (only full crawls do), while Glean enforces query-time and Google supports real-time sync
Microsoft doesn't support News Articles or APM/SPM Projects that Glean offers
Microsoft doesn't read category-level permissions (only item-level), while Glean supports full category permissions
Microsoft has 15-minute minimum delay vs Google's real-time webhook sync
Microsoft Tickets connector doesn't index attachments and comments, while Glean supports full metadata
Microsoft doesn't evaluate ACL rules comprehensively, while Glean has full ACL support via query-time enforcement
Microsoft connectors are read-only, while Google allows creating and updating incidents programmatically

snapshots.notes: Glean demonstrates strongest AI/automation capabilities with 67% faster ticket resolution. Google leads in real-time sync. Microsoft excels in documentation and enterprise identity integration but needs significant AI feature development.
